alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Basin and Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 12 at 7:41PM MDT until April 13 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 8 PM THURSDAY FOR MUCH OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO AS WELL AS THE SOUTHWEST MOUNTAINS AND MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Critical fire weather conditions are coming to an end as winds decrease and humidity begins rising along with cooling temperatures. However, winds will increase further on Thursday, once again combining with low humidity, above normal temperatures and an unstable atmosphere to produce critical fire weather conditions over much of southwestern, central and eastern New Mexico. Critical fire weather conditions may return on Friday across east central New Mexico as well. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125), and West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) from noon to 8 pm MDT Thursday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from near 7 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Basin and Range
